title: Ida B Wells on activism - patterns

content.question: Which of the following best describes Wells’s and other African American writers’ responses to the violence described in the excerpt?

choices.label: They advocated for the expansion of Black Codes as a means to protect African Americans from violence perpetrated by white people.
They worked to highlight the racism at the core of Southern lynching laws and protest the killing of Black people.
They used moral appeals to call on the Freedmen’s Bureau to protect African Americans from racially motivated violence.
They used the shock value of lynching to sell papers to white audiences and build economic success in Black communities.

content.answer: They worked to highlight the racism at the core of Southern lynching laws and protest the killing of Black people.

skill.text: 1.C: Identify and explain patterns, connections, or other relationships (causation, changes, continuities, comparison).
